an5.57:1.1.pli: “Pañcimāni, bhikkhave, ṭhānāni abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbāni itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
an5.57:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate should often review these five subjects.

an5.57:1.3.pli: ‘Jarādhammomhi, jaraṃ anatīto’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
an5.57:1.3.eng: ‘I am liable to grow old, I am not exempt from old age.’ A woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate should often review this.

an5.57:1.4.pli: ‘Byādhidhammomhi, byādhiṃ anatīto’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
an5.57:1.4.eng: ‘I am liable to get sick, I am not exempt from sickness.’ …

an5.57:1.5.pli: ‘Maraṇadhammomhi, maraṇaṃ anatīto’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
an5.57:1.5.eng: ‘I am liable to die, I am not exempt from death.’ …

an5.57:1.6.pli: ‘Sabbehi me piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
an5.57:1.6.eng: ‘I must be parted and separated from all I hold dear and beloved.’ …

an5.57:1.7.eng: ‘I am the owner of my deeds and heir to my deeds. Deeds are my womb, my relative, and my refuge.

an5.57:1.8.pli: Yaṃ kammaṃ karissāmi—kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā—
an5.57:1.8.eng: I shall be the heir of whatever deeds I do, whether good or bad.’

an5.57:1.9.pli: tassa dāyādo bhavissāmī’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
an5.57:1.9.eng: A woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate should often review this.

an5.57:2.1.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca ‘jarādhammomhi, jaraṃ anatīto’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā?
an5.57:2.1.eng: What is the advantage for a woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to grow old, I am not exempt from old age’?

an5.57:2.2.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ yobbane yobbanamado, yena madena mattā kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti, vācāya duccaritaṃ caranti, manasā duccaritaṃ caranti.
an5.57:2.2.eng: There are sentient beings who, intoxicated with the vanity of youth, do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.

an5.57:2.3.pli: Tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato yo yobbane yobbanamado so sabbaso vā pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti.
an5.57:2.3.eng: Reviewing this subject often, they entirely give up the vanity of youth, or at least reduce it.

an5.57:2.4.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca ‘jarādhammomhi, jaraṃ anatīto’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
an5.57:2.4.eng: This is the advantage for a woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to grow old, I am not exempt from old age’.

an5.57:3.1.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca ‘byādhidhammomhi, byādhiṃ anatīto’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā?
an5.57:3.1.eng: What is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to get sick, I am not exempt from sickness’?

an5.57:3.2.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ ārogye ārogyamado, yena madena mattā kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti, vācāya duccaritaṃ caranti, manasā duccaritaṃ caranti.
an5.57:3.2.eng: There are sentient beings who, drunk on the vanity of health, do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.

an5.57:3.3.pli: Tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato yo ārogye ārogyamado so sabbaso vā pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti.
an5.57:3.3.eng: Reviewing this subject often, they entirely give up the vanity of health, or at least reduce it.

an5.57:3.4.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca ‘byādhidhammomhi, byādhiṃ anatīto’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
an5.57:3.4.eng: This is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to get sick, I am not exempt from sickness’.

an5.57:4.1.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca ‘maraṇadhammomhi, maraṇaṃ anatīto’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā?
an5.57:4.1.eng: What is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to die, I am not exempt from death’?

an5.57:4.2.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ jīvite jīvitamado, yena madena mattā kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti, vācāya duccaritaṃ caranti, manasā duccaritaṃ caranti.
an5.57:4.2.eng: There are sentient beings who, drunk on the vanity of life, do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.

an5.57:4.3.pli: Tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato yo jīvite jīvitamado so sabbaso vā pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti.
an5.57:4.3.eng: Reviewing this subject often, they entirely give up the vanity of life, or at least reduce it.

an5.57:4.4.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca ‘maraṇadhammomhi, maraṇaṃ anatīto’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
an5.57:4.4.eng: This is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to die, I am not exempt from death’.

an5.57:5.1.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca ‘sabbehi me piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā?
an5.57:5.1.eng: What is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I must be parted and separated from all I hold dear and beloved’?

an5.57:5.2.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ piyesu manāpesu yo chandarāgo yena rāgena rattā kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti, vācāya duccaritaṃ caranti, manasā duccaritaṃ caranti.
an5.57:5.2.eng: There are sentient beings who, aroused by desire and lust for their dear and beloved, do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.

an5.57:5.3.pli: Tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato yo piyesu manāpesu chandarāgo so sabbaso vā pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti.
an5.57:5.3.eng: Reviewing this subject often, they entirely give up desire and lust for their dear and beloved, or at least reduce it.

an5.57:5.4.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca ‘sabbehi me piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
an5.57:5.4.eng: This is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I must be parted and separated from all I hold dear and beloved’.

an5.57:6.1.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca ‘kammassakomhi, kammadāyādo kammayoni kammabandhu kammapaṭisaraṇo, yaṃ kammaṃ karissāmi—
an5.57:6.1.eng: What is the advantage of often reviewing like this: ‘I am the owner of my deeds and heir to my deeds. Deeds are my womb, my relative, and my refuge.

an5.57:6.2.pli: kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā—tassa dāyādo bhavissāmī’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā?
an5.57:6.2.eng: I shall be the heir of whatever deeds I do, whether good or bad’?

an5.57:6.3.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ.
an5.57:6.3.eng: There are sentient beings who do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.

an5.57:6.4.pli: Tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato sabbaso vā duccaritaṃ pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti.
an5.57:6.4.eng: Reviewing this subject often, they entirely give up bad conduct, or at least reduce it.

an5.57:6.5.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca ‘kammassakomhi, kammadāyādo kammayoni kammabandhu kammapaṭisaraṇo, yaṃ kammaṃ karissāmi—
an5.57:6.5.eng: This is the advantage for a woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate of often reviewing like this: ‘I am the owner of my deeds and heir to my deeds. Deeds are my womb, my relative, and my refuge.

an5.57:6.6.eng: I shall be the heir of whatever deeds I do, whether good or bad.’

an5.57:6.7.pli: tassa dāyādo bhavissāmī’ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.

an5.57:7.1.pli: Sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati:

an5.57:7.2.pli: ‘na kho ahaññeveko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā jarādhammā jaraṃ anatītā’ti.
an5.57:7.2.eng: ‘It’s not just me who is liable to grow old, not being exempt from old age. For all sentient beings grow old according to their nature, as long as they come and go, pass away and are reborn.’

an5.57:7.3.pli: Tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato maggo sañjāyati.
an5.57:7.3.eng: When they review this subject often, the path is born in them.

an5.57:7.4.pli: So taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti.
an5.57:7.4.eng: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.

an5.57:7.5.pli: Tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti anusayā byantīhonti.
an5.57:7.5.eng: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.

an5.57:8.1.pli: ‘Na kho ahaññeveko byādhidhammo byādhiṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā byādhidhammā byādhiṃ anatītā’ti.
an5.57:8.1.eng: ‘It’s not just me who is liable to get sick, not being exempt from sickness. For all sentient beings get sick according to their nature, as long as they come and go, pass away and are reborn.’

an5.57:8.2.pli: Tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato maggo sañjāyati.
an5.57:8.2.eng: When they review this subject often, the path is born in them.

an5.57:8.3.pli: So taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti.
an5.57:8.3.eng: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.

an5.57:8.4.pli: Tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti, anusayā byantīhonti.
an5.57:8.4.eng: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.

an5.57:9.1.pli: ‘Na kho ahaññeveko maraṇadhammo maraṇaṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā maraṇadhammā maraṇaṃ anatītā’ti.
an5.57:9.1.eng: ‘It’s not just me who is liable to die, not being exempt from death. For all sentient beings die according to their nature, as long as they come and go, pass away and are reborn.’

an5.57:9.2.pli: Tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato maggo sañjāyati.
an5.57:9.2.eng: When they review this subject often, the path is born in them.

an5.57:9.3.pli: So taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti.
an5.57:9.3.eng: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.

an5.57:9.4.pli: Tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti, anusayā byantīhonti.
an5.57:9.4.eng: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.

an5.57:10.1.pli: ‘Na kho mayhevekassa sabbehi piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbesaṃ sattānaṃ piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo’ti.
an5.57:10.1.eng: ‘It’s not just me who must be parted and separated from all I hold dear and beloved. For all sentient beings must be parted and separated from all they hold dear and beloved, as long as they come and go, pass away and are reborn.’

an5.57:10.2.pli: Tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato maggo sañjāyati.
an5.57:10.2.eng: When they review this subject often, the path is born in them.

an5.57:10.3.pli: So taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti.
an5.57:10.3.eng: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.

an5.57:10.4.pli: Tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti, anusayā byantīhonti.
an5.57:10.4.eng: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.

an5.57:11.1.pli: ‘Na kho ahaññeveko kammassako kammadāyādo kammayoni kammabandhu kammapaṭisaraṇo, yaṃ kammaṃ karissāmi—kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā—tassa dāyādo bhavissāmi;
an5.57:11.1.eng: ‘It’s not just me who shall be the owner of my deeds and heir to my deeds.

an5.57:11.2.pli: atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā kammassakā kammadāyādā kammayoni kammabandhu kammapaṭisaraṇā, yaṃ kammaṃ karissanti—kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā—tassa dāyādā bhavissantī’ti.
an5.57:11.2.eng: For all sentient beings shall be the owners of their deeds and heirs to their deeds, as long as they come and go, pass away and are reborn.’

an5.57:11.3.pli: Tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato maggo sañjāyati.
an5.57:11.3.eng: When they review this subject often, the path is born in them.

an5.57:11.4.pli: So taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti.
an5.57:11.4.eng: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.

an5.57:11.5.pli: Tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti, anusayā byantīhontīti.
an5.57:11.5.eng: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.

an5.57:12.2.eng: and so are old age and death.

an5.57:12.3.eng: Though this is how their nature is,

an5.57:13.1.eng: If I were to be disgusted

an5.57:13.2.eng: with creatures whose nature is such,

an5.57:13.3.eng: it would not be appropriate for me,

an5.57:13.4.eng: since my life is just the same.

an5.57:14.2.eng: I understood the truth without attachments.

an5.57:16.4.eng: I’m committed to the spiritual life.”

an5.58:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
an5.58:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

an5.58:1.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya vesāliṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
an5.58:1.2.eng: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Vesālī for alms.

an5.58:1.3.pli: Vesāliyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto mahāvanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṃ nisīdi.
an5.58:1.3.eng: Then after the meal, on his return from almsround, he plunged deep into the Great Wood and sat at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.

an5.58:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā licchavikumārakā sajjāni dhanūni ādāya kukkurasaṅghaparivutā mahāvane anucaṅkamamānā anuvicaramānā addasu bhagavantaṃ aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisinnaṃ;
an5.58:2.1.eng: Now at that time several Licchavi youths took strung bows and, escorted by a pack of hounds, were going for a walk in the Great Wood when they saw the Buddha seated at the root of a tree.

an5.58:2.2.pli: disvāna sajjāni dhanūni nikkhipitvā kukkurasaṅghaṃ ekamantaṃ uyyojetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā tuṇhībhūtā tuṇhībhūtā pañjalikā bhagavantaṃ payirupāsanti.
an5.58:2.2.eng: When they saw him, they put down their strung bows, dispatched their hounds to one side, and went up to him. They bowed and silently paid homage to the Buddha with joined palms.

an5.58:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mahānāmo licchavi mahāvane jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno addasa te licchavikumārake tuṇhībhūte tuṇhībhūte pañjalike bhagavantaṃ payirupāsante;
an5.58:3.1.eng: Now at that time Mahānāma the Licchavi was going for a walk in the Great Wood when he saw those Licchavi youths silently paying homage to the Buddha with joined palms.

an5.58:3.2.pli: disvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
an5.58:3.2.eng: Seeing this, he went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side,

an5.58:3.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo licchavi udānaṃ udānesi:

an5.58:3.4.eng: “They will become Vajjis! They will become Vajjis!”

an5.58:4.1.eng: “But Mahānāma, why do you say that

an5.58:4.3.eng: “Sir, these Licchavi youths are violent, harsh, and brash.

an5.58:4.4.pli: Yānipi tāni kulesu paheṇakāni pahīyanti, ucchūti vā badarāti vā pūvāti vā modakāti vā saṅkulikāti vā, tāni vilumpitvā vilumpitvā khādanti;
an5.58:4.4.eng: Whenever sweets are left out for families—sugar-cane, jujube fruits, pancakes, pies, or fritters—they filch them and eat them up.

an5.58:4.5.eng: And they hit women and girls of good families on their backs.

an5.58:4.6.pli: Te dānime tuṇhībhūtā tuṇhībhūtā pañjalikā bhagavantaṃ payirupāsantī”ti.
an5.58:4.6.eng: But now they’re silently paying homage to the Buddha with joined palms.”

an5.58:5.1.pli: “Yassa kassaci, mahānāma, kulaputtassa pañca dhammā saṃvijjanti—

an5.58:5.2.pli: yadi vā rañño khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa, yadi vā raṭṭhikassa pettanikassa, yadi vā senāya senāpatikassa, yadi vā gāmagāmaṇikassa, yadi vā pūgagāmaṇikassa, ye vā pana kulesu paccekādhipaccaṃ kārenti, vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an5.58:5.2.eng: “Mahānāma, you can expect only growth, not decline, when you find five qualities in any gentleman—whether he’s an anointed aristocratic king, an appointed or hereditary official, an army general, a village chief, a guild chief, or a ruler of his own clan.

an5.58:6.2.pli: Idha, mahānāma, kulaputto uṭṭhānavīriyādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sedāvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi mātāpitaro sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti.
an5.58:6.2.eng: Firstly, a gentleman uses his legitimate wealth—earned by his efforts and initiative, built up with his own hands, gathered by the sweat of the brow—to honor, respect, esteem, and venerate his mother and father.

an5.58:6.3.pli: Tamenaṃ mātāpitaro sakkatā garukatā mānitā pūjitā kalyāṇena manasā anukampanti:
an5.58:6.3.eng: Honored in this way, his mother and father love him with a good heart, wishing:

an5.58:6.4.eng: ‘Live long! Stay alive for a long time!’

an5.58:6.5.pli: Mātāpitānukampitassa, mahānāma, kulaputtassa vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an5.58:6.5.eng: When a gentleman is loved by his mother and father, you can expect only growth, not decline.

an5.58:7.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, mahānāma, kulaputto uṭṭhānavīriyādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sedāvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi puttadāradāsakammakaraporise sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti.
an5.58:7.1.eng: Furthermore, a gentleman uses his legitimate wealth to honor, respect, esteem, and venerate his wives and children, bondservants, workers, and staff.

an5.58:7.2.pli: Tamenaṃ puttadāradāsakammakaraporisā sakkatā garukatā mānitā pūjitā kalyāṇena manasā anukampanti:
an5.58:7.2.eng: Honored in this way, his wives and children, bondservants, workers, and staff love him with a good heart, wishing:

an5.58:7.3.eng: ‘Live long! Stay alive for a long time!’

an5.58:7.4.pli: Puttadāradāsakammakaraporisānukampitassa, mahānāma, kulaputtassa vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an5.58:7.4.eng: When a gentleman is loved by his wives and children, bondservants, workers, and staff, you can expect only growth, not decline.

an5.58:8.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, mahānāma, kulaputto uṭṭhānavīriyādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sedāvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi khettakammantasāmantasabyohāre sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti.
an5.58:8.1.eng: Furthermore, a gentleman uses his legitimate wealth to honor, respect, esteem, and venerate those who work the neighboring fields, and those he does business with.

an5.58:8.2.pli: Tamenaṃ khettakammantasāmantasabyohārā sakkatā garukatā mānitā pūjitā kalyāṇena manasā anukampanti:
an5.58:8.2.eng: Honored in this way, those who work the neighboring fields, and those he does business with love him with a good heart, wishing:

an5.58:8.3.eng: ‘Live long! Stay alive for a long time!’

an5.58:8.4.pli: Khettakammantasāmantasabyohārānukampitassa, mahānāma, kulaputtassa vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an5.58:8.4.eng: When a gentleman is loved by those who work the neighboring fields, and those he does business with, you can expect only growth, not decline.

an5.58:9.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, mahānāma, kulaputto uṭṭhānavīriyādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sedāvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi yāvatā balipaṭiggāhikā devatā sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti.
an5.58:9.1.eng: Furthermore, a gentleman uses his legitimate wealth to honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the deities who receive spirit-offerings.

an5.58:9.2.pli: Tamenaṃ balipaṭiggāhikā devatā sakkatā garukatā mānitā pūjitā kalyāṇena manasā anukampanti:
an5.58:9.2.eng: Honored in this way, the deities who receive spirit-offerings love him with a good heart, wishing:

an5.58:9.3.eng: ‘Live long! Stay alive for a long time!’

an5.58:9.4.pli: devatānukampitassa, mahānāma, kulaputtassa vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an5.58:9.4.eng: When a gentleman is loved by the deities, you can expect only growth, not decline.

an5.58:10.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, mahānāma, kulaputto uṭṭhānavīriyādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sedāvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi samaṇabrāhmaṇe sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti.
an5.58:10.1.eng: Furthermore, a gentleman uses his legitimate wealth to honor, respect, esteem, and venerate ascetics and brahmins.

an5.58:10.2.pli: Tamenaṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇā sakkatā garukatā mānitā pūjitā kalyāṇena manasā anukampanti:
an5.58:10.2.eng: Honored in this way, ascetics and brahmins love him with a good heart, wishing:

an5.58:10.3.eng: ‘Live long! Stay alive for a long time!’

an5.58:10.4.pli: Samaṇabrāhmaṇānukampitassa, mahānāma, kulaputtassa vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an5.58:10.4.eng: When a gentleman is loved by ascetics and brahmins, you can expect only growth, not decline.

an5.58:11.1.pli: Yassa kassaci, mahānāma, kulaputtassa ime pañca dhammā saṃvijjanti—
an5.58:11.1.eng: You can expect only growth, not decline, when you find these five qualities in any gentleman—

an5.58:11.2.pli: yadi vā rañño khattiyassa muddhābhisittassa, yadi vā raṭṭhikassa pettanikassa, yadi vā senāya senāpatikassa, yadi vā gāmagāmaṇikassa, yadi vā pūgagāmaṇikassa, ye vā pana kulesu paccekādhipaccaṃ kārenti, vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānīti.
an5.58:11.2.eng: whether he’s an anointed aristocratic king, an appointed or hereditary official, an army general, a village chief, a guild chief, or a ruler of his own clan.

an5.58:12.1.eng: He’s always dutiful to his mother and father,

an5.58:12.2.eng: and for the good of his wives and children.

an5.58:12.3.eng: He looks after those in his household,

an5.58:12.4.eng: and those dependent on him for their livelihood.

an5.58:13.2.eng: looks after the welfare of relatives—

an5.58:13.3.eng: both those who have passed away,

an5.58:14.1.eng: While living at home, an astute person

an5.58:14.2.eng: uses legitimate means to give rise to joy

an5.58:15.3.eng: They praise him in this life,

an5.58:15.4.eng: and he departs to rejoice in heaven.”

an5.59:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, it’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who has five qualities.

an5.59:1.3.pli: Dullabho, bhikkhave, vuḍḍhapabbajito nipuṇo, dullabho ākappasampanno, dullabho bahussuto, dullabho dhammakathiko, dullabho vinayadharo.
an5.59:1.3.eng: It’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who is sophisticated, well-presented, and learned, who can teach Dhamma, and has memorized the monastic law.

an5.59:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato dullabho vuḍḍhapabbajitoti.
an5.59:1.4.eng: It’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who possesses these five qualities.”

an5.6:1.1.pli: “Na tāva, bhikkhave, akusalassa samāpatti hoti yāva saddhā paccupaṭṭhitā hoti kusalesu dhammesu.
an5.6:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, you don’t become unskillful as long as faith is established in skillful qualities.

an5.6:1.2.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, saddhā antarahitā hoti, assaddhiyaṃ pariyuṭṭhāya tiṭṭhati;
an5.6:1.2.eng: But when faith vanishes and faithlessness takes over,

an5.6:2.1.pli: Na tāva, bhikkhave, akusalassa samāpatti hoti yāva hirī paccupaṭṭhitā hoti kusalesu dhammesu.
an5.6:2.1.eng: You don’t become unskillful as long as conscience … prudence … energy … wisdom is established in skillful qualities.

an5.6:2.2.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, hirī antarahitā hoti, ahirikaṃ pariyuṭṭhāya tiṭṭhati;

an5.6:3.1.pli: Na tāva, bhikkhave, akusalassa samāpatti hoti yāva ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti kusalesu dhammesu.

an5.6:3.2.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, ottappaṃ antarahitaṃ hoti, anottappaṃ pariyuṭṭhāya tiṭṭhati;

an5.6:4.1.pli: Na tāva, bhikkhave, akusalassa samāpatti hoti yāva vīriyaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti kusalesu dhammesu.

an5.6:4.2.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, vīriyaṃ antarahitaṃ hoti, kosajjaṃ pariyuṭṭhāya tiṭṭhati;

an5.6:5.1.pli: Na tāva, bhikkhave, akusalassa samāpatti hoti yāva paññā paccupaṭṭhitā hoti kusalesu dhammesu.

an5.6:5.2.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, paññā antarahitā hoti, duppaññā pariyuṭṭhāya tiṭṭhati;
an5.6:5.2.eng: But when wisdom vanishes and witlessness takes over,

an5.60:1.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato dullabho vuḍḍhapabbajito.
an5.60:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, it’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who has five qualities.

an5.60:1.3.pli: Dullabho, bhikkhave, vuḍḍhapabbajito suvaco, dullabho suggahitaggāhī, dullabho padakkhiṇaggāhī, dullabho dhammakathiko, dullabho vinayadharo.
an5.60:1.3.eng: It’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who is easy to admonish, retains what they learn, and learns respectfully, who can teach the Dhamma, and has memorized the monastic law.

an5.60:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato dullabho vuḍḍhapabbajito”ti.
an5.60:1.4.eng: It’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who possesses these five qualities.”

an5.61:1.1.pli: “Pañcimā, bhikkhave, saññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mahānisaṃsā amatogadhā amatapariyosānā.
an5.61:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these five perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They have freedom from death as their objective and culmination.

an5.61:1.3.pli: Asubhasaññā, maraṇasaññā, ādīnavasaññā, āhāre paṭikūlasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā—
an5.61:1.3.eng: The perceptions of ugliness, death, drawbacks, repulsiveness of food, and dissatisfaction with the whole world.

an5.61:1.4.pli: imā kho, bhikkhave, pañca saññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mahānisaṃsā amatogadhā amatapariyosānā”ti.
an5.61:1.4.eng: These five perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They have freedom from death as their objective and culmination.”

an5.62:1.1.pli: “Pañcimā, bhikkhave, saññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mahānisaṃsā amatogadhā amatapariyosānā.
an5.62:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these five perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They have freedom from death as their objective and culmination.

an5.62:1.3.pli: Aniccasaññā, anattasaññā, maraṇasaññā, āhāre paṭikūlasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā—
an5.62:1.3.eng: The perceptions of impermanence, not-self, death, repulsiveness of food, and dissatisfaction with the whole world.

an5.62:1.4.pli: imā kho, bhikkhave, pañca saññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mahānisaṃsā amatogadhā amatapariyosānā”ti.
an5.62:1.4.eng: These five perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They have freedom from death as their objective and culmination.”

an5.63:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, vaḍḍhīhi vaḍḍhamāno ariyasāvako ariyāya vaḍḍhiyā vaḍḍhati, sārādāyī ca hoti varādāyī ca kāyassa.
an5.63:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a male noble disciple who grows in five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.

an5.63:1.3.pli: Saddhāya vaḍḍhati, sīlena vaḍḍhati, sutena vaḍḍhati, cāgena vaḍḍhati, paññāya vaḍḍhati—
an5.63:1.3.eng: He grows in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

an5.63:1.4.pli: imāhi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi vaḍḍhīhi vaḍḍhamāno ariyasāvako ariyāya vaḍḍhiyā vaḍḍhati, sārādāyī ca hoti varādāyī ca kāyassā”ti.
an5.63:1.4.eng: A male noble disciple who grows in these five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.

an5.63:2.1.eng: He who grows in faith and ethics,

an5.63:2.2.eng: wisdom, and both generosity and learning—

an5.63:2.3.eng: a good man such as he sees clearly,

an5.63:2.4.eng: and takes on what is essential for himself in this life.”

an5.64:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, vaḍḍhīhi vaḍḍhamānā ariyasāvikā ariyāya vaḍḍhiyā vaḍḍhati, sārādāyinī ca hoti varādāyinī ca kāyassa.
an5.64:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a female noble disciple who grows in five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.

an5.64:1.3.pli: Saddhāya vaḍḍhati, sīlena vaḍḍhati, sutena vaḍḍhati, cāgena vaḍḍhati, paññāya vaḍḍhati—
an5.64:1.3.eng: She grows in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

an5.64:1.4.pli: imāhi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi vaḍḍhīhi vaḍḍhamānā ariyasāvikā ariyāya vaḍḍhiyā vaḍḍhati, sārādāyinī ca hoti varādāyinī ca kāyassāti.
an5.64:1.4.eng: A female noble disciple who grows in these five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.

an5.64:2.1.eng: She who grows in faith and ethics,

an5.64:2.2.eng: wisdom, and both generosity and learning—

an5.64:2.3.eng: a virtuous laywoman such as she

an5.64:2.4.eng: takes on what is essential for herself in this life.”

an5.65:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu alaṃsākaccho sabrahmacārīnaṃ.
an5.65:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is fit to hold a discussion with their spiritual companions.

an5.65:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu attanā ca sīlasampanno hoti, sīlasampadāya kathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
an5.65:1.3.eng: A mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, and answers questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in ethics.

an5.65:1.4.pli: attanā ca samādhisampanno hoti, samādhisampadāya kathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
an5.65:1.4.eng: They’re personally accomplished in immersion, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in immersion.

an5.65:1.5.pli: attanā ca paññāsampanno hoti, paññāsampadāya kathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
an5.65:1.5.eng: They’re personally accomplished in wisdom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in wisdom.

an5.65:1.6.pli: attanā ca vimuttisampanno hoti, vimuttisampadāya kathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
an5.65:1.6.eng: They’re personally accomplished in freedom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in freedom.

an5.65:1.7.pli: attanā ca vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno hoti, vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadāya kathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti.
an5.65:1.7.eng: They’re personally accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in the knowledge and vision of freedom.

an5.65:1.8.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu alaṃsākaccho sabrahmacārīnan”ti.
an5.65:1.8.eng: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to hold a discussion with their spiritual companions.”

an5.66:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu alaṃsājīvo sabrahmacārīnaṃ.
an5.66:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.

an5.66:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu attanā ca sīlasampanno hoti, sīlasampadāya kathāya ca kataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
an5.66:1.3.eng: A mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, and answers questions posed when discussing accomplishment in ethics.

an5.66:1.4.pli: attanā ca samādhisampanno hoti, samādhisampadāya kathāya ca kataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
an5.66:1.4.eng: They’re personally accomplished in immersion, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in immersion.

an5.66:1.5.pli: attanā ca paññāsampanno hoti, paññāsampadāya kathāya ca kataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
an5.66:1.5.eng: They’re personally accomplished in wisdom, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in wisdom.

an5.66:1.6.pli: attanā ca vimuttisampanno hoti, vimuttisampadāya kathāya ca kataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
an5.66:1.6.eng: They’re personally accomplished in freedom, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in freedom.

an5.66:1.7.pli: attanā ca vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno hoti, vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadāya kathāya ca kataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti.
an5.66:1.7.eng: They’re personally accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in the knowledge and vision of freedom.

an5.66:1.8.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu alaṃsājīvo sabrahmacārīnan”ti.
an5.66:1.8.eng: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.”
